alert.note: Alert for Brown (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 18 at 10:20AM MDT until April 21 at 1:00AM MDT by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Dakota... Elm River at Westport affecting Brown County. .For sites with a river forecast, the forecast includes precipitation through the next 24 hours. Any future precipitation could affect the forecasts. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Elm River at Westport. * WHEN...Until early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Several gravel roads along the river begin to flood At 17.5 feet, Water reaches the bottom of the bridge north of Westport * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 14.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:00 AM CDT Tuesday was 14.5 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate above flood stage with a maximum value of 17.1 feet tomorrow morning. It will fall below flood stage Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abr. The next statement will be issued Wednesday evening by 730 PM CDT.
